item.title: Ruby: a nice way to get name of current method you’re in:
item.dc:creator: tobi
item.description: This is a nice extension to get the name of the method you’re currently in (Ruby < 1.9) [ruby] module Kernel private def this_method caller[0] =~ /`([^’]*)’/ and $1 end end [/ruby] for Ruby >= 1.9 you can uses this: [ruby] module Kernel private def this_method __method__ end end [/ruby] [see Stack Over Flow as […]
item.content:encoded:
This is a nice extension to get the name of the method you’re currently in (Ruby < 1.9)

[ruby]
module Kernel
private
def this_method
caller[0] =~ /`([^’]*)’/ and $1
end
end
[/ruby]

for Ruby >= 1.9 you can uses this:

[ruby]
module Kernel
private
def this_method
__method__
end
end
[/ruby]

[see Stack Over Flow as well]
